history.content:
When I declared a double in EECS (same process as switching), my advisor said that both EECS GPA and overall GPA have to be above a 3.3. You also need to have taken a certain number of the EECS lower divs/tech electives before being able to declare, depending on the number of semesters you've been here.

---

I declared a double in EECS and needed an EECS/overall technical/overal GPA all above 3.3 having taken at least 2 EECS courses for every semester I had been at Cal.

When I declared a double in EECS (same process as switching), my advisor said that both EECS GPA and overall GPA have to be above a 3.3. You also need to have taken a certain number of the EECS lower divs/tech electives before being able to declare, depending on the number of semesters you've been here.

---

I declared a double in EECS and needed an EECS/overall technical/overal GPA all above 3.3 having taken at least 2 EECS courses for every semester I had been at Cal.

When I declared a double in EECS (same process as switching), my advisor said that both EECS GPA and overall GPA have to be above a 3.3. You also need to have taken a certain number of the EECS lower divs/tech electives before being able to declare, depending on the number of semesters you've been here.

---

I declared a double in EECS and needed an EECS/overall technical/overal GPA all above 3.3 having taken at least 2 EECS courses for every semester I had been at Cal.

When I declared a double in EECS (same process as switching), my advisor said that both EECS GPA and overall GPA have to be above a 3.3. You also need to have taken a certain number of the EECS lower divs/tech electives before being able to declare, depending on the number of semesters you've been here.

Switching into EECS from another CoE major requires a 3.3 Technical GPA. Is overall Berkeley GPA considered in the switch? (If my overall CalCentral GPA is lower than my technical GPA, will that hinder me?)
history.subject: GPA Details on Switching
